fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2022e2.equipments.heater.mil

Class ExternalTemperatureModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.Model
      • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.AtomicModel
        • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.AtomicHIOA
          • fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2022e2.equipments.heater.mil.ExternalTemperatureModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.interfaces.EventsExchangingI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.interfaces.ModelDescriptionI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.interfaces.VariableInitialisationI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.interfaces.VariablesSharingI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.interfaces.AtomicModelI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.interfaces.ModelI, java.io.Serializable

    @ModelExportedVariable(name="externalTemperature",
                       type=java.lang.Double.class)
public class ExternalTemperatureModel
extends fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.AtomicHIOA
    The class ExternalTemperatureModel defines a simulation model for the environment, namely the external temperature of the house.

    Description

    The model makes the temperature vary over some period representing typically a day. The variation is taken as a cosine between Math.PI and 3*Math.PI. The cosine (plus 1 and divided by 2 to vary between 0 and 1) is taken as a coefficient applied to the maximal variation over a day and then added to the minimal temperature to get the current temperature.

    The model reevaluates the external temperature at some predefined rate i.e., the evaluation step. It exports this temperature in a variable called externalTemperature.

    Invariant

     invariant       MAX_EXTERNAL_TEMPERATURE > MIN_EXTERNAL_TEMPERATURE
 invariant       PERIOD > 0.0
 invariant       STEP > 0.0
 invariant       cycleTime >= 0.0 && cycleTime <= PERIOD

    Created on : 2021-09-23

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
